intro: Caldasia andicola, commonly known as the Andean caldasia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
